meanings.definition: Of or relating to tweed fabric.
meanings.sent1: The tweedy jacket felt rough against his skin.
meanings.sent2: She wore a tweedy skirt to the countryside picnic.
meanings.sent3: The tweedy hat made him look like a stylish detective.
meanings.sent4: The old book had a tweedy cover that reminded her of cozy winters.
meanings.sent5: The tweedy texture of the sofa was comforting and warm.

meanings.sent1: The tweedy professor walked into the lecture hall.
meanings.sent2: They attended the party in tweedy suits and dresses.
meanings.sent3: The tweedy outfit gave her a sophisticated air.
meanings.sent4: His tweedy attire made him blend in at the vintage fair.
meanings.sent5: The tweedy ensemble was perfect for the autumn weather.

meanings.definition: Resembling tweed in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The tweedy carpet added a cozy feel to the room.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fur had a tweedy look to it.
meanings.sent3: The tweedy wallpaper gave the room a rustic charm.
meanings.sent4: The tweedy pattern on the pillow was soothing to look at.
meanings.sent5: The tweedy fabric of the curtains matched the sofa perfectly.
